metadata.description: Global Surface Air Temperature for February 2026

outcome_space.description: Global surface air yemperature for February 2026

base_case.condition: What will be the global surface air temperature anomaly measured against pre-industrial levels (1850–1900) for month ending {observation.reference_date}?
base_case.fsp_resolution: FSP equals the global surface air temperature anomaly measured against pre-industrial levels (1850-1900) for the month ending {observation.reference_date} as published by the EU Copernicus Climate Change Service in their 'Surface air temperature' monthly Climate bulletin. The 1850-1900 reference period is used by UN Climate Action <https://www.un.org/en/climatechange> for monitoring the approach of global temperature to the limits specified in the COP21 Paris Agreement of 2015. Primary sources: <https://climate.copernicus.eu/climate-bulletin> for month ending {observation.release_date}; underlying data {source_name} {source_uri}. Secondary sources: 'ERA5 monthly averaged data on single levels (C3S/ECMWF)' monthly <https://cds.climate.copernicus.eu/datasets/reanalysis-era5-single-levels-monthly-means> and daily <https://sites.ecmwf.int/data/climatepulse/data/series/era5_daily_series_2t_global.csv> (daily); the Copernicus methodology for calculating the offset for the reference period 1850-1900 is described at <https://climate.copernicus.eu/climate-bulletin-about-data-and-analysis>.

edge_cases.condition: EU Copernicus Climate Change Service does not publish a global surface air temperature anomaly measured against pre-industrial levels (1850-1900) for the month ending {observation.reference_date} by 31 calendar days after {observation.release_date}

outcome_space.source_name: Copernicus Climate bulletin, Surface air temperature

oracle_config.description: Manual oracle system for product settlement
